pageContext.description: End of socket broken off. Remains of one rivet hole with a rivet inside. Remains of wooden haft adhering to the inside of the socket. Blade decorated with three ribs running on both sides. Tip of blade broken off. Cutting edge almost as sharp as the back edge. Both edges rather worn.
pageContext.patina: Dark brown patina with few green spots. Metal showing through at the edges and on top of ribs.
pageContext.collection: Private Collection,Dr. Henry Bergh, 18, Thames Side, Staines, Middlesex.
pageContext.site: England,Surrey (Berkshire),Runnymede,Thames,1/4 ile upstream from Bell Weir Lock,July 1961,Found on Thames bank in the gravel rim about 2" of water within 3" of the dredger passing site.
pageContext.toSearch: Runnymede, Windsor Road, Old Windsor, Surrey Sl4 2jl, UK
